intro: Psychotria bangweana, commonly known as the Bangweana Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the shaded, moist environments of the forest floor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
